bcl:section.bcl:text:
This Act comes into force by regulation of the Lieutenant Governor in
          Council.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section:

bcl:text.#text:
means an individual who performs the work of, or
              provides any aspect of the services provided by, a security guard service.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
A person must not operate an armoured vehicle except under the authority of a
            valid armoured vehicle permit issued in the person's name.

Subsection
              (2) does not apply to

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a peace officer,

a person who holds a valid security worker licence, authorizing the person to
              work as a security guard, while the person is providing, in the course of their
              employment under that licence, security services that involve operating an armoured
              vehicle,

bcl:text.#text:
a person who holds a valid security worker licence, authorizing the person to
              work as an armoured car guard, while the person is providing, in the course of their
              employment under that licence, security services that involve operating an armoured
              vehicle, as defined under the , or

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a person who is exempt under the regulations.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person may apply to the registrar for

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a permit authorizing the person to operate an armoured vehicle, or
the renewal of such a permit.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An application for an armoured vehicle permit or renewal must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: be made in the form and manner required by the registrar,

include authorizations for the registrar to carry out the prescribed checks
              regarding the applicant or permit holder, and
be accompanied by the prescribed fees.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
An applicant for an armoured vehicle permit or the renewal of an armoured
            vehicle permit must meet all conditions and requirements imposed by this Act or the
            regulations.

The registrar may refuse to issue or renew an armoured vehicle permit if any of
            the following applies:

bcl:text.#text:
the applicant or permit holder fails in any way to comply with, or does not
              meet the requirements of, section 3 ;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the applicant or permit holder has been convicted of a crime.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
The registrar must hold a hearing before making a decision under subsection
              (1).

The registrar must give the applicant or permit holder written reasons for a
            decision under subsection (1).

The registrar may issue or renew an armoured vehicle permit for a term not
            exceeding the prescribed period.
The registrar may

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
impose any terms and conditions on an armoured vehicle permit that the
              registrar considers appropriate, and
amend or remove those terms and conditions.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
The registrar must give the applicant or permit holder written reasons for a
            decision under subsection (2).

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Terms and conditions of armoured vehicle permit
bcl:section.bcl:text:
The following are terms and conditions of every armoured vehicle
          permit:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
the permit holder must carry the permit at all times when operating an armoured
            vehicle;

the permit holder, when operating an armoured vehicle, must produce the armoured
            vehicle permit on the request of a peace officer;

the permit holder must report to the registrar, within 14 days of its
            occurrence,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the theft or loss of the permit,

a change in the permit holder's employment, if the operation of an armoured vehicle
              under the permit is for the purposes of that employment,

a change in circumstances such that the permit holder is no longer able to
              demonstrate that the permit holder requires the permit for a purpose prescribed for the
              purpose of section 4 (1) (d),
a change in the permit holder's residential address, or

a charge being laid or a conviction entered against the permit holder for a
              crime;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
the permit holder must surrender the permit to the registrar on or before the
            last day of the term of the armoured vehicle permit;
the permit holder must

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: comply with this Act and the regulations, and
comply with the terms and conditions of the permit;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
the permit holder must not allow another person to use the armoured vehicle
            permit.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
A person must not own, operate or use a vehicle that contains an after-market
            compartment.

A person who installs an after-market compartment in a vehicle must immediately
            contact the officer in charge of the nearest Provincial or municipal police office and
            provide to that officer all of the following information:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the name and address of the owner of the vehicle;
the make, model and year of the vehicle;

where in the vehicle the compartment has been placed and how the compartment
              can be opened.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
Subsection
              (1) does not apply in respect of a person who owns, operates or uses a
            vehicle containing an after-market compartment if the owner of the vehicle is exempt
            from subsection
              (1) under the regulations.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Armoured vehicle permit cancellation or suspension

bcl:text.#text:
The registrar may cancel, or suspend for a period of time, an armoured vehicle
            permit for any reason under section 4 (1) .

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The registrar must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: hold a hearing before making a decision under subsection (1), and
give the permit holder written reasons for the decision.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
If under subsection (1) the registrar cancels, or suspends for a period of time, an
            armoured vehicle permit, the permit holder, immediately or within the period specified
            by the registrar in the decision or reasons, must surrender the permit to the
            registrar.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Summary action to protect the public

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
If the registrar considers it necessary to protect the public, the registrar,
            immediately and without notice, may cancel, or suspend for a period of time, an armoured
            vehicle permit.

As soon as practicable after making a decision under subsection
              (1), the registrar must give the permit holder written notice of and
            written reasons for the decision.

An armoured vehicle permit holder who receives a notice under subsection
              (2)

bcl:text.#text:
must immediately surrender the armoured vehicle permit to the registrar or, if
              the notice is delivered by a peace officer or by an inspector, as defined in the
                , to the peace officer or
              inspector, as applicable,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: must cease operating the armoured vehicle, and

may file a written reply with the registrar within 15 days after the date of
              the notice.

bcl:text.#text:
Section 29 (4) to (7) of the  applies to a suspension or cancellation under this section
            and, for that purpose, a reference in that section

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
to a licence is deemed to include an armoured vehicle permit referred to in
                subsection
                (1) of this section, and

to subsection (3) is deemed to be a reference to subsection
                (3) of this section.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote:
Seizure of armoured vehicle or vehicle containing after-market compartment
          without a warrant

bcl:text:
If a peace officer has reasonable grounds for believing that a person is
            operating an armoured vehicle and, on request of the peace officer, the
            person

the peace officer, without a warrant, may seize the motor vehicle and take it to
            a secure place for the purpose of preserving the motor vehicle until a search warrant is
            obtained.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
refuses or is unable to produce a valid armoured vehicle permit,
              and

is unable to satisfy the peace officer that the person is exempt under
                section 2
                (3) from the requirement to hold an armoured vehicle permit,

bcl:text:
the peace officer, without a warrant, may seize the vehicle and take it to a
            secure place for the purpose of preserving the vehicle until a search warrant is
            obtained.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:

              operating or using a vehicle that contains an after-market compartment, and

on request of the peace officer, the person is unable to satisfy the peace
              officer that the person is exempt under the regulations from the prohibition in
                section 7
                (1),

bcl:text.#text:
Sections 24 to 24.2 of the  apply in respect of a vehicle seized under subsection
              (1) or (2) of this section.

If, under section 24 (2) (a) of the , a justice orders that a vehicle referred to in subsection (3)
            of this section be detained, despite section 24 (3) of the , the vehicle may be detained for up to one year before an
            order under section 24 (5) of that Act, authorizing its continued detention, is
            required.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
If a vehicle contains an after-market compartment, and the owner is not exempt
            under the regulations from the prohibition in section 7 (1), a peace officer
            may order the owner, operator or user of the vehicle to cease operating or using, as
            applicable, the vehicle until the after-market compartment has been removed.

A peace officer who makes an order under subsection (1) may also order
            the owner, operator or user to demonstrate to the person specified in the order, at the
            location and within the period, or at the time, specified in the order that the
            after-market compartment has been removed.

During the period, or until the date, specified in an order under subsection
            (2), if the vehicle is not operated or used, section 7 (1) does not apply to
            the owner of the vehicle in respect of that person's ownership of the
            vehicle.

If a motor vehicle is an armoured vehicle and the operator does not hold an
            armoured vehicle permit, and is not exempt from that requirement, a peace officer may
            order the operator to cease operating the motor vehicle.
A person who contravenes any of the following commits an offence:

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
When applying for an armoured vehicle permit or when requested, ordered or
            directed by the registrar to provide information, a person must not provide false or
            misleading information.

A person does not commit an offence under subsection (2) if, at the time
            the information was provided, the person did not know that the information was false or
            misleading and, with the exercise of reasonable diligence, could not have known that the
            information was false or misleading.
A person must not

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
obstruct, impede or refuse to admit a peace officer who is exercising powers
              or performing duties under this Act or under a warrant issued for the purposes of
              enforcing this Act, or
obstruct or impede an inspector referred to in section 9 (3).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
A person must not use an armoured vehicle permit that has been issued to another
            person.

A person must not produce to any person as a valid armoured vehicle permit an
            armoured vehicle permit

bcl:text.#text:
that has been cancelled under section 9
                (1) ,
              or

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
during a period when the armoured vehicle permit is suspended under section 9
                (1).

bcl:text.#text:
If a business entity, as defined in the , commits an offence under this Act, an employee, officer,
            director, partner or agent of the business entity who authorizes, permits or acquiesces
            in the commission of the offence also commits an offence, whether or not the business
            entity is prosecuted for the offence.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
In a prosecution for an offence under this Act, it is sufficient proof of the
            offence to establish that it was committed by an employee, officer, director, partner or
            agent of the defendant, whether or not the employee, officer, director, partner or agent
            is identified or has been prosecuted for the offence.

bcl:text.#text:
Section 5 of the  does not apply for the
            purposes of this Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Time limit for commencing a prosecution

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
The time limit for laying an information to commence a prosecution for an
            offence under this Act is

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
one year after the date on which the act or omission that is alleged to
              constitute the offence occurred, or

if the registrar issues a certificate described in subsection
                (2), one year after the date on which the registrar learned of the act or
              omission referred to in paragraph (a).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
A certificate purporting to have been issued by the registrar certifying the
            date referred to in subsection (1) (b) is proof of that date.

bcl:text.#text:
An individual who commits an offence under section
              12  is liable on conviction to a fine of
            not more than $10 000 or imprisonment for not longer than 6 months, or both.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
A business entity that commits an offence under section 12 is liable on
            conviction to a fine of not more than $100 000.

bcl:text.#text:
Section 47 of the  applies in
          relation to this Act and, for that purpose, a reference in that section to a "licence" or
          a "document" is deemed to include an armoured vehicle permit and a document in the
          registrar's records respecting an armoured vehicle permit.

Section 48 of the  applies to a
          notice, request or written reasons under this Act and, for that purpose, a notice, request
          or written reasons under this Act are deemed to be a notice, request or written reasons
          referred to in Part 4 of the .

An applicant or permit holder may request the registrar to reconsider a decision
            under section 4
              (1) , 5
              (2)  or 8
              (1) .

The time limits in section 51 (1) (a) and (b), and section 51 (2) and (3), of
            the  apply for the purposes of a
            request under subsection (1) of this section.

Section 50 of the  applies in
          relation to armoured vehicle permits and, for that purpose, a reference in that section to
          a "licence" is deemed to include an armoured vehicle permit.

bcl:section.bcl:text:
The registrar may hold a hearing under this Act in writing, electronically or
          orally or by any combination of written, electronic or oral hearings.

bcl:text.#text:
The Lieutenant Governor in Council may make regulations referred to in
            section 41 of the .

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
Without limiting subsection (1), the Lieutenant Governor in Council may
            make regulations as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: respecting the forms of applications and permits;

bcl:text.#text:
prescribing checks regarding applicants for the purposes of section
                3 ;

prescribing purposes for the purpose of section 4 (1)
                (d) ;

prescribing a maximum period for the purposes of section 5
                (1) ;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
prescribing the information that an applicant for an armoured vehicle permit
              is required to provide;

bcl:text.#text:
establishing an offence for the contravention of a regulation and prescribing
              a penalty for that offence up to the maximum penalties set out in
              section 14 .

Section 2
            (2) 
          does not apply for a period of 90 days after the date section 2 comes into force to a
          person who operates an armoured vehicle for a purpose prescribed under section 20 (2)
            (d) .
